ABSTRACT Lactic acid is one of the materials with high added value that can be obtained from glycerol, having the most varied applications in different industries, such as chemical and pharmaceutical; currently being studied due to its important application in obtaining polylactic acid (PLA), a biodegradable polymer. The objective of this work was the production of lactic acid from glycerol in an alkalin e medium using three different copper catalysts supported on s√≠lica (SiO 2) (9%Cu/SiO 2-D2, 9%Cu/SiO 2-F1 and 9%Cu10MgO/SiO 2) with 5% copper to the mass of the glycerol solution, using a simple batch reaction system, with the variation of the parameters tempe rature, reaction time and concentration of reagents. For all catalysts, the catalytic tests were carried out with a NaOH/glycerol mass ratio of 1 , and a NaOH concentration equal to 0 ,6 M. With the catalyst 9%Cu/SiO 2-D2, the catalytic tests were carried out in a reaction time of 6 hours, using temperatures of 220¬∫C, 250¬∫C, 280¬∫C , and 300¬∫C, with glycerol concentrations of 0 ,6 M and 3 ,3 M. The results showed satisfactory results of glycerol conversion (58 ,9%) and selectivity to lactic acid (69 ,4%) at temperat ures higher (280¬∫C and 300¬∫C), and that the tests performed with the lowest concentration base were the ones that presented better results, corroborating what was expected in the literature. The tests with the catalyst 9%Cu/SiO 2-F1 were carried out using t he glycerol concentration equal to 0 ,6 M, reaction time of 6 hours , and temperatures of 250¬∫C, 280¬∫C , and 300¬∫C. The results indicated a good conversion of glycerol (54 ,0%) and selectivity to lactic acid (59 ,8%) at higher temperatures (300¬∫C). The paramete rs used for the tests with the 9%Cu10MgO/SiO 2 catalyst were reaction temperatures of 220¬∫C, 250¬∫C , and 280¬∫C and reaction times of 3, 4.5 and 6 hours. The results indicated greater conversion (53 ,7%) and selectivity to lactic acid (58 ,9%) at a higher temperature (280¬∫C). Thus, it was concluded that the catalysts were favorable in these reactions and the reaction temperature combined with the reaction time proved to be important parameters in the evaluation of the conversion and selectivity to la ctic acid, so that the only by - product obtained in small quantities was pyruvaldehyde, due to the greater predisposition to the formation of this intermediate by the Cannizzaro reaction. In general, the 9%Cu10MgO/SiO 2 catalyst presented better performance in hydrothermal glycerol conversion reactions, which can be explained by the addition of MgO to this catalyst, obtaining a better conversion results and selectivity to lactic acid using temperatures up to 280¬∫C.
